plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are woody perennial flowering plants known for their large, often fragrant flowers. They come in a wide variety of colors and are beloved worldwide in gardens and landscapes.
plants.funFact: Some rose species can bloom repeatedly throughout the growing season, and rose hips are rich in vitamin C.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A tall flowering plant with dense, colorful spikes of pea-like flowers commonly found in wild and cultivated settings. It is popular for its ornamental value and nitrogen-fixing ability.
plants.location: Pacific Northwest of North America but widely naturalized and cultivated in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Lupines improve soil fertility by fixing nitrogen; they have specialized root nodules with bacteria for this purpose.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: An aquatic perennial that produces large, showy flowers floating above the water surface. It holds cultural and religious significance in Asia.
plants.location: South Asia, Southeast Asia, parts of Australia and cultivated worldwide in suitable climates
plants.funFact: The lotus flowerâ€™s seeds can remain viable for over 1,000 years, one of the longest seed longevity records.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree or shrub with cylindrical flower spikes that bloom with numerous small flowers packed densely. Often blooms throughout the year including early summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round with peak flowering in autumn and early summer
plants.funFact: Banksias are important nectar sources for many Australian birds and mammals, especially honeyeaters.
